attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Employers should pay for staff to get home safe if they work past midnight
attributes.background: Employers should be held responsible for making sure their staff get home safe when working late shifts, especially young staff working in city centres. Hospitality staff in particular work late hours in at risk areas  & shouldn't be put in positions which make them vulnerable to attack.
attributes.additional_details: Working in hospitality for the last 6 years I've seen people been put at risk on their way home from work. Due to the nature of the job, working hours and the social climate within our city centres walking home alone can be threatening and potentially dangerous . Employers should value and take a degree of responsibility for the fact that their employees are looked after at all times - this shouldn't end at the door of work.

attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.

attributes.action: The government should raise the funding for music education in primary schools.
attributes.background: This government has cut funding for musical education in primary schools. The funding should be increased back to what it was in 2010 before the conservatives came to government. Despite Nicky Morgan's claims, music is a necessary part of education, and should be something no child should lack.
attributes.additional_details: To make a film better, we add music. To improve a dining experience, we add music. To make shopping experiences better, we add music. To make schools better, we take away music. This is wrong and should be undone. The government cut funding for a vital part of education for primary school children. These children now no longer learn anything in school about music: something every child should understand, at least on a simple level. The funding should be increased.

attributes.action: Invest more in our National Security to avoid an attack in the UK
attributes.background: Europe is getting unsecured. There has been terror attacks in the most important countries like France, Belgium and Germany. The United Kingdom may be affected in the future as well. We more security, especially on train staions, crowded places, Tourist attractions and big cities.

attributes.action: Switch the UK timezone to match the rest of Europe
attributes.background: The rest of western Europe has changed their timezone to UTC + 1 and since these countries are extremely close, it would be sense from a trade, enterprise and consumer point of view that this should be changed for the better.

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Place an additional tax of 10p a packet on chewing gum to pay the clean up costs
attributes.background: According to the LGA it costs £1.50 to clean a piece of chewing gum from a pavement. Not all chewing gum users are irresponsible about its disposal but it is wrong for general taxation to pay the clean up costs. A levy of 10p a packet (plus an explanation on the packet) will offset part of the costs
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimate that it costs £60M a year to clean up chewing gum. http://www.local.gov.uk/media-releases/-/journal_content/56/10180/6745145/NEWS

attributes.action: Free school transport for primary schools and high schools
attributes.background: Costs of travelling to school everyday add ups and parents struggle to pay for it. Also, the safety of the children is at risk of getting kidnapped or killed due to having to walk miles to school alone and/or on busy roads.

attributes.action: Change the law, to give people in rural village communities the right to buy.
attributes.background: I’m living in a housing association home in a village I grew up in.The Housing (Right to Acquire or Enfranchise)(Designated Rural Areas in the Southwest) Order 1997  stops selling of right to buy properties in villages/towns with populations of less than 3000 residents it is unfair  on rural tenants
attributes.additional_details: My application to have the right to aquire/buy in January 2016 was rejected. I’ve written to and been ignored by my local MP for support and received an unsatisfactory reply from Brandon Lewis, Housing Minister at the time (Even though he agrees to the sale of housing association homes). My only recourse is this petition to get the issue raised in parliament and hopefully remove the 3000 resident  stipulation as the housing and planning bill including, right to buy is currently being considered

attributes.action: Enable transfer of pension funds to lifetime ISA for use as a mortgage deposit
attributes.background: I struck upon an idea where you could possibly transfer a stakeholder pension into the new lifetime ISA coming soon.  The idea would be to only allow for security against a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details: I would suggest that the transferred fund would be exempt from the annual government bonus but attract normal interest.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Theresa May; Appoint a Minister of State for Climate Change
attributes.background: In Theresa May's first Cabinet appointments she abolished the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change moving the brief with Business. To ensure that Climate Change is at the heart of British politics we want a Climate Change Minister to work with all departments.
attributes.additional_details: Since the creation of the Energy and Climate Change department, climate change policy has largely been driven by using more sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister working in the Business department  could design new climate change policies that are not only just focused on sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister could be responsible for growing the green economy and encouraging corporate social responsibility.

attributes.action: Ban public transport peak fares, especially on suburban commuter routes.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the few countries in the world where commuter public transport users suffer a peak fare system, with transport often owned by foreign interests. Commuters are essentially being penalised and profited from unnecessarily as they go to work, often making car usage more attractive.
attributes.additional_details:
Budapest - 80p per individual suburban bus or underground journey any time of day 
Kuala Lumpar -  23p per stop on underground Metro (modern air-conditioned Siemens trains) any time of day
Barcelona - £1.80 individual bus or underground journey any time of day
Lisbon - individual journey bus on-board fare - £1.50 any time of day
Melbourne - all-zone 2-hour tram or bus ticket, £2 any time of day
Bangkok - daily any time Skytrain pass £2.60 (Bangkok is a very big city of 12 million people!)

attributes.action: Review British army prior Laser Eye surgery policy
attributes.background: Currently you cant have laser eye before joining the British army prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards. As laser eye surgery makes you eyesight better why should the minimum standards before the surgery stop you. Why stop people getting Laser Eye surgery so there can serve their country
attributes.additional_details: "Spectacle or contact lens corrections must not be greater then -6 dioptres or +6 dioptres in any meridian." - Army Jobs "Laser Eye surgery or anything alike would not enable you to join as your prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards." - Army Jobs.

attributes.action: Allow ALL tax payers to vote.
attributes.background: People who have no job and are claiming benefits but have been born in the UK are allowed to vote. People who were born elsewhere and moved here and are paying taxes and making a valuable contribution to the country they live in do NOT have the right to vote in the UK.

attributes.action: Put metal detectors in all schools in England make our schools safer
attributes.background: Too many young kids and teachers are being attacked while they are in school where they are suppose to be getting a education. No mother,father or guardian wants to be at home or work and get the news that something has happen to there loved one at school.

attributes.action: Stop the rise of youth crime- introduce harsher punishments as a deterrent.
attributes.background: As young people we think youth crime is a problem and more needs to be done about it. We think there should be harsher punishments, especially for repeated offenders as it is unfair all young people and teenagers are labeled 'thugs'.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Daily Mail, under 18s commit a quarter of all crimes.

Statistics on www.gov.uk show that in 2013/14 there were 90,769 offences which resulted in a disposal, and the most common offence was violence against the person.

attributes.action: Set up  a legally binding code of conduct/ethics for insurance companies.
attributes.background: Currently it is completely legal for insurers to deliberately use delaying tactics when dealing with no fault insurance claims.  Make it illegal to delay claims by constantly changing case handlers, refusing to acknowledge communication and simply stalling just  to name a few.

attributes.action: Require restaurants to specify menu items that are microwave meals
attributes.background:
I propose that restaurants should be required to inform customers on their menu whether a meal is microwaved or prepared fresh.

A large number of restaurants and pubs regularly include ready meals and microwave meals on their menu but are not required to inform customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Requiring restaurants to state this information would allow customers to make a more informed decision on what they're eating, as many people like myself would rather not include microwave meals in their diet, especially when paying a premium for eating it in a restaurant.

This change would hopefully lead customers to ordering freshly made meals, encouraging restaurants to change their practices and perhaps helping their unskilled staff gain kitchen qualifications to help further their careers.

attributes.action: Unite all 43 police forces in England and Wales into one National Police Force.
attributes.background: A lot of money can be saved by the ilmination of duplication and as far as the British public is concerned, apart from the accent the North Yorkshire force is the same as the Met.

attributes.action: Relax immigration rules for elderly/disabled parents of British Citizens
attributes.background: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father.
attributes.additional_details: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father. I am married with 2 school attendee children in UK hence very stressful & difficult situation for me to go back India to look after my parents. Please allow me to bring my parents here in UK.

attributes.action: Use £23.4 billion  Trident costs to feed, protect and educate our children.
attributes.background: Every year the poorest people in Britain are asked to support other poor people by donating to children in need etc.  We ask that the money for Trident be spent to protect vulnerable children and that those who want Trident hold a telethon to raise money for it.
attributes.additional_details: People of all ages, but especially children are suffering and living in unacceptable poverty whilst hard working tax payers watch their money being spent on weapons of mass destruction that aren't wanted and will never be used.  This must change.

attributes.action: Make relevant work experience mandatory for students doing University courses.
attributes.background: I have found many Graduates I know who are unable to secure themselves job roles due to lack of experience. Also according to The Guardian in 2013, almost half of the Graduates are jobless. They are rejected due to the fact that they do not have 1 year experience. Exception is for those who have it.
attributes.additional_details:
A source for my claim is shown below: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/nov/19/half-recent-uk-graduates-stuck-jobs-ons

By making gaining work experience proposal mandatory, economy may boost. Less JSA claimants. Less students debts. The list goes on. It usually takes years and I mean years for Graduates to secure their relevant job roles due to lack of experience. Yes, you may say that they can do work experience while searching but that's not always the case due to lack of finance.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: Establish an electoral system that requires an MP to receive 50% +1 of  turnout.
attributes.background: The UK electorate like to have an individual to vote for and be accountable. The current system allows an MP to take up a seat when the majority of constituents vote against them. Rendering them unaccountable.

attributes.action: Make It Complusory For Every Biker To Have A Helmet Cam!
attributes.background: Loosing somebody that is close to you is never easy. Epecially when it may seem like you don't have any closure to what happened to them. I think that it ALL bikers should wear helmet cams so should the worst happen to them the family can be justified and it could also make the inquest easier.

attributes.action: A call for direct use of the military in Libya
attributes.background: The civil war in Libya is awful and needs to be stopped as it is allowing jihadist groups to gain control over the North of Africa, i believe we should but an end to this war with direct force

attributes.action: Only allow the UK to go to war after allowing the citizens to vote Yes or No.
attributes.background: The decision to go to war should not rest in the hands of the politicians. We voted them in to act in our best interests but it is obvious this is not the case. Going to war costs a massive amount of money, time and lives. We should protect our country from invasion. Not invade others.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot Inquiry

attributes.action: We should have a cross party coalition to negotiate our exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
Our exit from the EU should be negotiated with at least two members from the Brexit camp.
This isn't just a petition aimed at people who voted Leave, these negotiations affect all of us, so please sign this petition and let's get the right people in the negotiations to get the right deal for us!

attributes.action: Pass a law to allow left turns on a red light.
attributes.background: Will reduce traffic congestion and pollution from stationary traffic waiting to turn left at a red light... This road traffic law is legal in many other countries, lets introduce here in the UK...

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: to make telling jokes about child abuse illegal
attributes.background: i feel that people will tell child abuse jokes and think its funny and fine i strongly disagree with this going back decades,, protesting on building sites etc,,, before social media
attributes.additional_details: a guy was telling a michael jackson joke back in the mid nineties on a building site,, i said sorry mate don't like those kind of jokes,,, not fair on children,, him and i went toe to toe,, i didn't mind it seems many jokes about adults,, are offensive and wrong but jokes so called about children are fine,,, this is totally wrong,, totally

attributes.action: Cap private renting to affordable prices for working families
attributes.background: Private renting in the UK is at an all time high increased far more than wages and families are struggling to make ends meet because of over priced private properties to rent. The government should set out new legislation for landlords to abide by.

attributes.action: Make CBD available on the NHS to children suffering dravet syndrome.
attributes.background: Dravet syndrome is a severe and intractable epilepsy. there is a growing interest among families, physicians and the medical community in the use of cannabidiol (CBD) for the treatment of Dravet syndrome. CBD is one of more than 60 cannabinoids in the marijuana plant. CBD is not psychoactive.

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.

attributes.action: Add Black English to the national census
attributes.background: In England and Wales, non-white ethnic groups, as such, are not offered the standard option of including ‘English’ as part of their ethnic group: they’re officially classified only as ‘Black British’, ‘Asian British’, etc., and not ‘Black English’ or ‘Asian English’.
attributes.additional_details: By contrast, black and Asian persons living in Scotland are permitted to identify as ‘Black Scottish’ and ‘Asian Scottish’.English people" are both a nation and an ethnic group, having white skin is not a requirement.

attributes.action: Make panel van speed limits the same as cars.
attributes.background:
Speed limit for vans on an A road is 50mph - the same as a lorry.
This was set in 1982 when vans did not have disc brakes, ABS, etc.
An increase to 60mph would help with traffic flow and stop dangerous overtaking of vans.

attributes.action: Provide visas for 1st degree relatives of international students for graduation
attributes.background: International students are expected to pay university fees far in excess of their British counterparts and therefore pay much more towards improving and maintaining the universities. Sadly, we often turn our backs on these people by refusing their family visas to attend their graduation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to teach all kinds of religion in schools equally
attributes.background: Schools are currently teaching religious studies or religious education to our children which is heavily based on Christianity. If it was compulsory to teach all religions and cultures our kids would have more understanding and be more accepting to people with different beliefs reducing segregation.
attributes.additional_details: Recent political movements have lead to a 52 percent rise in race related reports. I believe this starts at home and in school. If we educate our children in school about every religion we can they will develops educated views and become more tolerant and accepting of others. This is so very important to our multi cultural society and progression as humans that we need to get this movement to change the way we teach.

attributes.action: Stop night time road closures which is costing haulage companies millions
attributes.background: Road closures during the night are costing lorry drivers millions in lost time and fuel. The diversions off of some motorways can add an hour on to a journey. It seems like the highways agency find it easier to close a road rather put a contaflow in place.

attributes.action: Give all UK Residents with NI number a vote. No taxation without representation.
attributes.background:
At 16 someone can legally leave school, get a job and pay tax. But they are denied a vote in General Elections on how that tax is spent.

The same is true for hard-working UK residents without UK citizenship. 

To address this iniquity give everyone with a National Insurance number a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Current eligibility rules for voting in General Election (Electoral Commission)
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/voter/registering-to-vote-and-the-electoral-register

Current eligibility rules for National Insurance number (HMRC)
https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bnq2cY299xs

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Make it an act of treason to attempt to overturn legitimate elections/referendum
attributes.background: To attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action subverts the nation's democratic nature.
attributes.additional_details: It is an act of treason to aid the enemy: to attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action runs counter to the nation's democratic nature.

attributes.action: Brexit talks by committee of 65, on the basis of proportional representation.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has now voted to leave the EU, to ensure that the negotiations are carried out with every person from every political background being represented I propose a committee carry out the talks based on a Proportional Representation distribution of seats from the last General election.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the biggest political event in our life times, no one party should be tarred with the negotiations of extracting the United Kingdom from the EU.
All parts of society need to feel 'United' in a common goal and see first hand that their voice is being heard.
The Scottish, Welsh, Irish, Labour, Conservatives, Lib dems, Greens, Ukip all represent the United Kingdom.... Let us Unite for the common good where no one is left behind unheard.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.
